did.head: Collection Summary

origination.label: Creator
origination.persname: Collection compiled by Education Manager and Library Director, Joshua Ritter, and Library Advisory Board Member, Ken Bloom.

did.unittitle: Goodspeed Musicals Scherer Library of Musical Theatre Priority Archive
did.abstract: Ken Bloom, a distinguished theatre historian, playwright, director, record producer, author, and member of the Goodspeed Library Advisory Board consulted with Education Manager and Library Director, Joshua Ritter, to select items to add to the Priority Archive. These valuable items, more than 500 total, include a full original partitur for "West Side Story", a recording of Steven Sondheim performing "Saturday Night", and signed books and letters from countless Broadway legends.
did.physloc: Main Reading Room: Black cabinets 2,3,4,6, two boxes on shelves, and two boxes on top of cabinets in Institutional Archives

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: The copyright law of the United States (Title 17, United States Code) governs the making of photocopies or other reproductions of copyrighted material. Under certain conditions specified in the law, libraries and archives are authorized to furnish a photocopy or other reproduction. One of these specific conditions is that the photocopy or reproduction is not to be "used for any purposes other than private study, scholarship, or research." If a user makes a request for, or later uses, a photocopy or reproduction for purposes in excess of "fair use," that user may be liable for copyright infringement. This institution reserves the right to refuse to accept a copy order if, in its judgment, fulfillment of the order would involve violation of copyright law.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Most Items were donated to the Scherer Library of Musical Theatre by Goodspeed Musicals patrons. Some items were originally created by Goodspeed Musicals.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Audio CDs were transferred from reel-to-reel format.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: The Scherer Library of Musical Theatre at Goodspeed is the only library dedicated solely to musical theatre in the world. The collection boasts more than 100,000 items, providing an invaluable resource to academics and professionals around the world. Dedicated to preserving the rich legacy of the art form, the library carefully maintains a comprehensive collection of scores, sheet music, scripts, original cast recordings, programs, photographs, and theatre memorabilia in a facility located in East Haddam, Connecticut. Currently, these reference tools are utilized by Goodspeed staff and the musical theatre community at large in the re-creation and revitalization of period musicals and in the creation and development of new works. To access the online catalog, please click here. Established in the 1970s to provide historical research for Goodspeed productions, the library has evolved into a valuable resource for theatres across the country, as well as students, scholars and the public. The Scherer Library of Musical Theatre is the only specialized library in the country directly connected to a fully professional producing musical theatre.
To visit the Scherer Library of Musical Theatre website, please click on the following link: http://www.goodspeed.org/education-library/library

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Thanks to a generous grant from the Harold and Mimi Steinberg Charitable Trust, Goodspeed was able to launch the Catalogue and Digitization Project. This project involved the preservation of the Scherer Library's most fragile, valuable, and important items. The following list is a small sample of some of the items, more than 500 total, that were included in the project:

1. Photo of Joseph Jefferson as Rip Van Winkle 2. Letters by Oscar Hammerstein II 3. Archival script of "Du Barry Was a Lady" 4. "Pousse Cafe" Program 5. Labor Stages "Pins and Needles" program 6. Journal from Max Showalters tour with "This is the Army" 7. Goodspeed Muscials archival recording of "Whoopee"

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged by format. These include broadsides, libretti, playbills, letters, photos, art prints, periodicals, scores, books, CDs, and other print formats.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Musical theater
controlaccess.corpname: Goodspeed Musicals Scherer Library of Musical Theatre

relatedmaterial.head: Related Collections
relatedmaterial.p: The Special Archive is another artificial archive which contains items that were deemed significant, but not worthy of inclusion in the Priority Archive.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: There are two oversized boxes and two smaller boxes that are not stored with the majority of the collection.
Main Reading Room: Black cabinets 2,3,4,6, two boxes on shelves, and two boxes on top of cabinets in Institutional Archives
